title: Rewrite $$2$$ As a Fraction Using the LCD.
text: LCD for $$\frac{3x}{x-4}$$ and $$2$$ is $$(x-4)$$, we can rewrite $$2$$ as $$\frac{2\left(x-4\right)}{x-4}$$. We can rewrite $$\frac{3x}{x-4}-2$$ as $$\frac{3x}{x-4}-\frac{2\left(x-4\right)}{x-4}$$.

title: Rewrite $$2$$ As a Fraction Using the LCD.

title: Use the Critical Points to Divide the Number Line into Intervals.
text: Given that the $$x=-8$$ and $$x=4$$ are the two critical points, we can divide the number line into three intervals, namely, $$(-\infty,-8)$$, $$(-8,4)$$ and $$(4,\infty)$$.

title: Test a Value in Each Interval.

title: Determine the Intervals Where the Inequality is Correct.
